‚ÄúIt was beyond our imagination that Food for the Hungry stood beside us and resolved our sufferings,‚Äù shared Mohammad, chairman of the Community Development Committee in a village outside of Cox‚Äôs Bazar, Bangladesh.

For years, families in this community‚Äîhome to 300 landless people‚Äîstruggled with water scarcity and poor sanitation. Women walked half a kilometer to fetch water, and the lack of proper facilities made daily life even harder.

Through your support, Food for the Hungry was able to install new WASH (water, sanitation, and hygiene) facilities, including water points, bathrooms, and toilets‚Äîbringing clean water right to their doorsteps. Now, families have safe water access, improved hygiene, and a brighter future.

Thank you for making this life-changing impact possible!üíß

In Cox‚Äôs Bazar, Bangladesh, Food for the Hungry‚Äôs CEO Mark Viso and Chief Programs and Public Resource Officer Kate visited newly installed WASH (water, sanitation, and hygiene) facilities, providing clean water and promoting better hygiene practices for local families. They also engaged with mothers and children about better food practices and nutrition. These essential services are improving health, one community at a time.

Thank you for being part of this life-changing work!

#HealthAndHygiene #CommunityDevelopment #FoodForTheHungry #MakingADifference

üåç World Health Day is TODAY April 7!

In classrooms across the globe, health and hope go hand in hand.

This young boy is receiving healthcare essentials at his school‚Äîbecause when children are healthy, they can learn, grow, and dream big.

From checkups to clean water, from nutrition to hygiene education‚Äîwe believe every child deserves a chance to thrive.

ü©∫ Health isn‚Äôt just about medicine‚Äîit‚Äôs about opportunity.

üíô This #WorldHealthDay, join us in building a future where every child has access to both education - and - healthcare. Because when we care for the whole child, we break the cycle of poverty for good.

Learn how you can help: http://fh.org/health

#WorldHealthDay #CleanWater #WASHprogram #HealthForAll #HopeStartsHere #EndPoverty #ChildHealth #EducationForAll

President & CEO of Food for the Hungry, Mark Viso, testified to the House Appropriations subcommittee on national security and the Department of State on April 2nd.

During his testimony, he shared Food for the Hungry's mission, drawing on Micah 6:8 ‚Äúto act justly and to love mercy and to walk humbly with your God.

‚ÄúFood for the Hungry designs, develops, and delivers catalytic solutions that build resilience so that children, families, and communities can flourish. We are privileged to partner with U.S. churches and faith communities, as well as the private sector, the U.S. government, and other donor governments, to deliver vital humanitarian assistance and development programs that restore health, hope, and dignity to individuals in some of the world‚Äôs hardest places.

‚ÄúFood for the Hungry last year reached nearly 10 million people in 20 countries experiencing extreme poverty, delivering improved food security and nutrition to over half a million vulnerable children and mothers, ensuring access to clean water for over 700,000 people, and creating more than $14 million in assets.

‚ÄúAs an experienced, faith-based implementer of U.S. foreign assistance programs, I respectfully ask the Subcommittee to provide robust funding in FY26 for critical humanitarian, development and global food and nutrition programs.‚Äù

"I grew up knowing my family was one of the three poorest in our community. Other children didn‚Äôt value me because they knew our struggles. But I refused to let that define me." ‚Äì Fabrice

At just four years old, Fabrice and his family returned to Burundi with nothing‚Äîno land, no resources, and no opportunities. His parents worked tirelessly just to put food on the table. But Fabrice had a dream: to break the cycle of poverty through education.

Food for the Hungry walked alongside Fabrice, providing school supplies, encouragement, and even a young goat that would multiply into a life-changing source of income. His sponsors, Marc and Anne from Canada, gave him hope‚Äîreminding him that he was seen, valued, and capable of more.

Through sheer determination, Fabrice not only graduated but went on to earn a university degree in Rural Economics. 

üëèToday, he‚Äôs helping his younger sisters continue their education, investing in his community, and inspiring others to rise above their circumstances.

‚ú® "If I could meet my sponsors, I‚Äôd thank them deeply. Their kindness changed my life." ‚ú®

Fabrice‚Äôs story is proof that sponsorship doesn‚Äôt just change lives‚Äîit transforms entire futures.

üêùBeekeeping in Burundi! 

FH Burundi supported this farming cooperative to get modern beehives. The modern hives allow for greater honey production and in turn, greater collection! üçØ

The traditional beehives are put in trees to gather the bees. When there are enough inside, the hives are closed up with mud and carried on the beekeeper's head, to this location with the modern beehives. Over time the bees transfer to the modern hives.

The beekeepers have a tradition - they first smoke the hives so the bees are calm, then open the box and verbally greet the bees üëã 

Bees supply a regular source of income, pollinate crops, and boost the local agriculture. Sounds pretty sweet! üêù

With over 4,000 varieties, it‚Äôs no wonder this humble crop has become a global staple. From the vibrant Andes mountains to plates worldwide, Peruvian potatoes are a gift to the world.

At just 22, Juana faced overwhelming challenges‚Äîa young marriage, spiritual division, and a son battling acute malnutrition. 

But her resilience lit the way! üôå

Through the Food for the Hungry "Caregiver Group", Juana embraced life-changing skills training lessons, nursed her son back to health, and found hope in the story of Ruth shared by Food for the Hungry Facilitator Maria. Her faith rekindled -- Juana and her husband now attend church together, building a future rooted in love and trust in God. 

‚ù§Ô∏è Your support helps rewrite stories like Juana's. 

Learn how you can make a difference at fh.org. 

#FaithInAction #TransformingLives #FoodForTheHungry

Flooding made it hard for 8-year-old Althea to get to school safely‚Äîbut not anymore! Thanks to Food for the Hungry‚Äôs rubber boots distribution, she and other kids can walk to school without fear of flood-related diseases. 

Because of your support, a simple solution is making a big impact! ü•æüåßÔ∏è

#FoodFortheHungry #FHImpact #ImpactStory #FaithInAction

‚ú® As we reflect on the incredible impact made in 2024, we‚Äôre filled with gratitude for your generosity and support. Together, we‚Äôve brought hope and opportunity to so many families around the world. üåç

Let's step into the new year ready to create even more lasting change.

#FoodFortheHungry #NewYear #HopeinAction #MakeAnImpact

Your $10 donation becomes $220 of impact!

Through our 22x Program, matching grants multiply your gift to provide food, clean water, and more to families in need.

üåç Impact Their Tomorrow ‚Äì Give Today! üåç

Your support creates lasting change in communities around the world. When you donate to FH, you‚Äôre not just meeting immediate needs‚Äîyou‚Äôre investing in education, health, and livelihoods that strengthen communities for the long term.

Our approach goes beyond aid. We partner with local communities and leaders to build lasting solutions, empowering them to address complex issues and realize their full potential. For over 50 years, our mission has been rooted in a vision to end poverty worldwide, inspired by faith and dedicated to service.

Donate today and help us build resilience where it‚Äôs needed most.

üéÑ This Christmas, sponsored children used tablets and a special app to create your Christmas Card. It's a pioneering leap forward, opening doors to their digital future, creating closer connections with you, and it's making a big difference for our staff on the ground.  

‚ÄúThis has magically reduced our paperwork and the burden of carrying heavy stacks of paper into the community for kids to write to their sponsors," says Fidele, Area Coordinator in Rwanda.

text:
Merry Christmas from your friends at Food for the Hungry around the world! üåç

Through your love and support, hope and joy are reaching sponsored children and their families this Christmas. From celebrating Jesus' birthday to creating memories that last a lifetime, your kindness inspires dreams and shares His love.

Thank you for making this possible. Together, we continue to change lives. 

#FoodfortheHungry #MerryChristmas #ChristmasMorning2024 #SharingHope #FHImpact #TogetherWeCan

Looking for an affordable gift catalog item that offers a huge impact? Give a chicken! 

For only $22, a gift of TWO chickens provides a sustainable source of protein through their eggs, improving the nutrition of children. Plus families can sell the extra eggs for income!

Bless a family today: www.fh.org/gifts
üíª Sponsors! Check your email today‚Äîspecial Christmas cards and updated photos from your sponsored children are waiting for you! üéÑ‚ú®

This Christmas season, sponsored children worldwide are creating heartfelt Christmas cards for their sponsors using tablets for the very first time! 

These digital tools are opening doors to creativity, connection, and the digital world‚Äîbringing children and their sponsors closer than ever.

Your sponsorship doesn‚Äôt just transform lives; it fosters creativity, digital confidence, and relationships that span continents. 

#FH #FoodForTheHungry #TabletLearning #ChildSponsorship #ChristmasConnection #HopeAndJoy
üôèüèºüíö

My goal is to have all 19 of these children sponsored by the end of this year! Comment ‚ÄúYes‚Äù and I‚Äôll DM you more info about how you can start sponsoring a child today. Merry Christmas! ‚ù§Ô∏è

#foodforthehungry #seasonofgiving #generosity #makeadifference

text: ‚ù§Ô∏èüôèüèº‚ù§Ô∏èüôèüèº‚ù§Ô∏è

üéÑ Eight-year-old Rady is delighted to create a special Christmas card for his sponsor‚Äîusing a tablet üì± for the first time! ‚ÄúThis has been such a special experience,‚Äù he says. 

Your sponsorship nurtures children like Rady with skills, encouragement, and opportunities to thrive and become all God created them to be. Thank you for making a lasting impact!

Did you know that the jeepney is an iconic symbol of the Philippines? 

Originally crafted from U.S. military jeeps after World War II, these colorful, decorated vehicles have evolved into a beloved mode of transport that embodies Filipino creativity and resilience. Whether you're hopping from one neighborhood to the next or simply admiring the vibrant designs, jeepneys are a true reflection of the Filipino spirit! üáµüá≠ üöê

#FH #FoodfortheHungry #Phillipines #Jeepney #DYK #DidYouKnow #FunFacts #NonProfit

With the gift of a Female Dignity Kit, you can help change this story. Each kit provides essentials for comfort and confidence, helping girls in Bolivia, Cambodia, Ethiopia, Haiti, Kenya, and more stay in school, pursue their dreams, and build brighter futures. 

This holiday season, give a gift that promotes dignity, supports education, and transforms lives.

  ‚Äî  FH child sponsor from Harvest Springs Community Church 

Do you sponsor a child? We‚Äôd love to hear how it has impacted your life ‚Äî share with us in the comments below! üôè

In 2023, we were able to meet 93% of projected impact goals and hope to meet even more in 2024. Last year, we launched a new program called Resilience and Flourishing through Systems Transformation (RFST). This system will focus on building resilience and improving well-being, while also addressing the root causes of poverty and injustice. 

As we know, implementing a new way to measure impact is progress and we are excited that starting with the 2024 impact report, measurement of our progress will be fully aligned to our new system.

üóìÔ∏è Make a Difference Before the Year Ends üóìÔ∏è

Give a gift that changes lives! Your year-end gift to FH doesn‚Äôt just help‚Äîit multiplies! Thanks to our generous government and agency partners, every dollar you give has 22x more impact on life-changing programs worldwide.

By donating now, you‚Äôre supporting nutritious food, clean water, and essential education in communities around the world. üåç 

Check the link in comments below to make your gift go even further today. Let's make a lasting difference together!

üö® Thanks to your generosity, 1,100 families in Bolivia impacted by devastating wildfires have received water, food, and essential medicine‚Äîhelping 2,850 children and adolescents cope with this crisis. üíßüçûüíä

But the work isn‚Äôt done. Many families have lost homes, livestock, and crops. Your support fuels emergency aid and sustainable solutions for the most vulnerable.

üåü Special thanks to donors for bringing renewed hope to remote communities like Ascencio de la Frontera, where 15 families were facing severe food shortages.

üíõ Together, we are making a difference. Give today to help us reach more families in need.

#Bolivia #DisasterRelief #ThankYou

Child Sponsors, you should have received your annual Christmas card to send to your sponsored child through the mail!

Be sure to fill out the card and send a special Christmas blessing in time. It's simple and takes just minutes.

Meet Lillian Hanmann, a 19-year-old student at Wisconsin Lutheran College who‚Äôs not only studying Leadership and Communications but is also living it out! Inspired by her sponsored child in Guatemala, Lillian took on a unique community service project as part of her Christian Leadership program. She decided to make a difference by organizing a Candy Apple Fundraiser ‚Äî and it was a sweet success! üçé üçé üçé

With donated apples from Patterson Orchards, Lillian and a group of friends spent a weekend making delicious caramel apples. 

‚ÄúThe best part was how our community came together to support a great cause,‚Äù Lillian shared. At a local football game, they sold the candy apples and raised $600 for her sponsored child's community in Guatemala. 

Why did she do it? Lillian first learned about Food for the Hungry‚Äôs sponsorship program at a TobyMac concert and felt called to help. Her passion for creating impact led her to dream up this fundraiser, and she hopes to continue supporting FH‚Äôs work to bring lasting change.

Join the movement! 

Get inspired like Lillian and find creative ways to give back. Together, we can help communities build brighter futures. üåç 

#FoodForTheHungry #ChildSponsorship #CandyAppleFundraiser #GiveBack #Milwaukee #WisconsinLutheranCollege #Changemaker #Bethechange

Hasem Ali has worked his land for 15 years, relying on it to support his family. But in 2020, with the help of FH‚Äôs vegetable training and seeds, Hasem was able to cultivate more than just crops‚Äîhe cultivated a brighter future for his family.

Hasem says, ‚ÄúMy land is my strength. It makes me happy with its beauty, and I am thankful for my land to God.‚Äù Thanks to your generous gift of vegetable seeds, Hasem can now grow a variety of nutritious vegetables like beets, cabbage, eggplant, and more, providing his family with food and savings for the future. 

Your gift of seeds can make a world of difference, helping families like Hasem‚Äôs thrive in Ethiopia, Nicaragua, Peru, Uganda, Cambodia, Burundi, and Rwanda. Head to the link in comments to give the gift of growth this season and watch hope take root. üåæ

We're dedicated to creating inclusive, participatory learning environments where everyone feels valued. Our approach connects education to cultural values, helping learners develop a sense of responsibility and community engagement.

üåü Incredible Impact Alert! üåü

Thanks to YOU, Food for the Hungry‚Äôs Child Sponsorship in Vietnam has become a powerful force for change in communities! 

üéâ Your support isn‚Äôt just transforming individual lives‚Äîit‚Äôs creating waves of positive impact across entire villages! This year alone, Vietnam made incredible strides in health, safety, and sustainable livelihoods:

ü™• Health: 680 students from two schools learned how to take care of their teeth and received toothpaste and toothbrushes! Healthy smiles mean healthier futures!

üçÉ Sustainable Livelihoods: We empowered 50 households with training in tea production and processing techniques, and 20 households even received irrigation rigs for their tea fields. These tools and skills mean steady income and brighter futures!

üõµ Safety: 286 middle school students participated in traffic safety training, and 30 students received helmets, equipping them to travel safely and confidently.

With every child sponsored, we take another step toward lasting change and hope for all families in Vietnam. üíô

Watch the video (linked in comments) to see the amazing progress you‚Äôre helping make possible! 

Together, we‚Äôre building a future full of hope and opportunity. ‚ú®

Our hearts are with those who are hurting and working to rebuild. Join us in praying for hope, resilience, and support for the people affected by this disaster.

text:
"I have a dream of completing my education and being able to stand on my feet." - Shilpi (Sponsored Child)

Your support is transforming lives! Thanks to your generosity, we are seeing incredible progress for children, families, and entire communities in Bangladesh. üåç‚ù§Ô∏è

In 2024, through your support, FH has put committees in place to reduce child marriages and provide at-risk girls much-needed support. Over 17,500 children received educational materials, and thousands of families gained new skills, tools, and resources to break the cycle of hunger and earn a sustainable income. 

üôè As we move into 2025, we ask for continued prayers for:
- At-risk girls to remain safe and protected from early child marriage
-Children receiving educational support to thrive academically
-Families to continue building skills and resources for a brighter future 

Your generosity is creating lasting change today and beyond! ‚ú®

üíß Clean Water is a Lifeline üíß

Every day, over 1,000 children lose their lives to preventable diseases caused by unsafe water and poor sanitation. At Food for the Hungry, we‚Äôre on a mission to change that! Through our WASH program, we‚Äôre providing clean water, building sanitation systems, and educating communities on hygiene, saving lives and transforming futures.

üåç Together, we can ensure every child has the chance to grow up healthy, strong, and full of hope. Will you join us?

üëâ Donate today to bring clean water and dignity to vulnerable communities.
‚ÄúThis is my commandment, that you love one another as I have loved you." -John 15:12 #SundayScripture

Ny Sa Em is a 6-year-old girl from Cambodia. Before FH entered her community, her family, like many other families in her community, struggled to provide for themselves.

"6 years ago, my family was [a] vulnerable family. [We] had a small hut covered with coconut leaves. My parents and siblings were sick all the time."

Through your support, FH was able to enter Ny Sa Em's community and her family received the gift of chickens. Chickens can serve as a great source of protein and can also provide additional income for the family through the sale of eggs. 

"...Now my family‚Äôs living condition has transformed...with a decent house after my family started to raise the chickens. My other two sisters [and I] have received education...[along with] other children in the community."

Thank you for your support of families like Ny Sa Em's.

Happy Friday! 

Celebrate this achievement with us. üéâ

We are pleased to share this success from FH Programs in our 2023 Impact Report. üíö

#ImpactReport #childnutrition #foodforthehungry
Experience the joy and fulfillment that comes from being part of something so impactful‚Äîyour decision to sponsor a child could be the start of a journey that changes both of your lives forever.

From Stewart Goodwin, FH W.A.S.H. Program Manager: 
"I am grateful to be part of the work at Food for the Hungry and the importance of our mission.

Access to water, sanitation, and hygiene (W.A.S.H.) is a basic human right and essential for the health and development of children and communities worldwide. Tragically, over 1,000 children under the age of 5 die every day from diarrheal diseases due to inadequate W.A.S.H. services. In conflict areas, children are nearly 20 times more likely to die from diarrheal diseases than from violence itself.

Inadequate access to sustainable W.A.S.H. contributes to malnutrition, conflict, gender-based inequities, poor agricultural outcomes, the spread of disease, and endemic poverty. Thus, W.A.S.H. is fundamental to health and livelihoods and essential for communities to become resilient and flourish.

Equally important is *water quality*. Here‚Äôs a picture from a water quality training we conducted in Ukhia, Bangladesh, earlier this year. Our efforts are helping to empower communities with the knowledge and resources to ensure safe drinking water for all.

Let's continue to advocate for access to clean water and proper sanitation globally, ensuring that every child has the opportunity to thrive."

‚ÄúWe used to survive. Now, we are building a future.‚Äù

Food for the Hungry‚Äôs five-year program in Mwumba, Burundi has officially wrapped up, and the impact is truly life-changing! üí´ From improved education and health services to enhanced agriculture and economic stability, the entire community is now thriving and looking ahead to a brighter future.

One of the most powerful moments of our visit? Witnessing how childhood malnutrition dropped by *OVER 30%* and hearing firsthand stories from families who now have hope for *generations to come*. üôåüèº

It‚Äôs a celebration of resilience, partnership, and transformation! üéâ

Lach Lin is from Cambodia, and before FH entered her community in 2017, her family struggled from many water-related issues. 

"We used to drink from a water tank that does not have a lid and the water does not boil properly, causing family members to experience diarrhea, typhoid fever, and abdominal pain," she says. 

After FH entered her community, she was provided with access to clean water as well as chickens to raise and seeds to properly grow vegetables.

"My family is not as sick as before because we live with good hygiene. I have the courage from FH staff to share with others, even though I cannot read," Says Lach. 

Through your support, Lach Lin and her family were provided with the proper resources they needed to thrive physically and emotionally.
For Guidmon Urcuyo, the Bible helped put him on the path to leadership in his community of El Limonal, Nicaragua. Now he volunteers with Food for the Hungry‚Äôs programs. üôåüèº

üö∞ Water is Life, and So Much More üö∞

Imagine not knowing if the water your family drinks is safe. This is a daily reality for millions. But at Food for the Hungry, we believe that access to clean water is a basic human right! 

üíß Through our W.A.S.H. programs, we‚Äôre empowering communities to take control of their water resources and build healthier, resilient futures.

üìà In countries like Bangladesh and Nicaragua, we're making a lasting impact‚Äîproviding clean water, improving sanitation, and restoring hope. üíô
Happy Friday! üíö

‚ÄúChildren must grow in health, wisdom and faith to live out the fullness of life that God has planned for them. But, in the world‚Äôs hardest places, poor health gets in the way of children‚Äôs dreams.‚Äù

Throwback to the early years of walking with communities around the globe to help children and families reach their God-given potential!

Did you know that 1 in 10 people around the world face chronic hunger‚ùì   

This World Food Day reminds us of the urgent need to respond to hunger globally. With your support, we can provide life-saving food and aid. And thanks to our partners, your gift will be multiplied 22x!

text: Food for the Hungry‚Äôs commitment to justice is evident in our holistic approach to community development. By focusing on empowerment, equal access to resources, gender equity, and sustainable development, FH works to correct injustices and give vulnerable people the opportunity to live with dignity, hope, and self-reliance. It is our biblical call to ‚Äúdo justice, love mercy, and walk humbly‚Äù (Micah 6:8).

Have you written to your sponsored child recently? 

ü´∂  It‚Äôs more than just a letter‚Äîit‚Äôs a gift of love, hope, and connection that travels thousands of miles, touching the hearts of children around the world. 

‚úèÔ∏è When you write a letter, you‚Äôre not only sharing your own story, but you‚Äôre also showing a child that they are valued, remembered, and cherished. 

üíå For many kids, these letters become treasured keepsakes‚Äîa reminder that someone far away believes in their dreams. 

Ready to make their day special? Take a few moments to write your sponsored child a letter - or send a message instantly through our website! üíª 

#Sponsorship #WriteALetter #EndPoverty #ImpactfulGiving #SponsorAChild #FHImpact #FoodfortheHungry
#SundayScripture

A glimpse of what your sponsored child's life is like in Bangladesh: 

üíöHouses are commonly rectangular and made out of mud, bamboo, or red brick with thatched roofs. Many are built on platforms to keep them above the flood line.

üíöMany meals are cooked in spicy curry sauces that incorporate cumin, coriander, cloves, cinnamon, garlic, and other spices.

üíöPrimary education, which is free but not required by law, is for children 10 and under. Only about half of all children in Bangladesh attend primary school.

üíöPeople greet each other with, ‚ÄúAssalam Waleykum‚Äù (peace be with you) and respond with, ‚ÄúWaleykum Assalam‚Äù (and with you).

Today is World Gratitude Day!  And we‚Äôre so grateful for YOU! 

THANK YOU for walking alongside us as we work to meet the physical, emotional, and spiritual hungers of the world‚Äôs most vulnerable people. 

Whether through prayer, sponsoring a child, giving your time/treasure/talents, or raising awareness, you all play a key role in ending extreme poverty and we couldn‚Äôt do the work we do without you!

#WorldGratitudeDay #worldgratitudeday2024

Monourom (standing) was sponsored as a child through FH Cambodia. Because of her active participation, she became a teacher volunteer to teach other children in the community. 

Meanwhile, her family has transformed to live a better quality of life since they have been involved with FH programs. To date, their family has enough food to eat, access to clean water, and better health.

When you sponsor a child today, who knows how many other lives you'll impact!

Kabesha Furahisha is a mother who received FH training that changed some of the cultural myths she previously held. ‚ÄúI was told that when I get pregnant, I should only eat very little so that I won‚Äôt have difficulty giving birth,‚Äù she said. 

The effect of the wrong advice is that she gave birth to an underweight baby, 3.3 pounds.

‚ÄúDuring my recent pregnancy, I learned from the mother leaders that I should eat the right foods,‚Äù Kebesha said. That included a little protein, some carbohydrates and vitamins. ‚ÄúThe teachings helped me a lot.‚Äú This time, she gave birth to a 6.6 pound baby. ‚ÄúI really thank FH,‚Äù she said while proudly showing off her daughter.

FH‚Äôs Maternal and Nutrition Trainings are truly changing lives -- giving little ones the healthy start they need to grow strong and thrive, so they can fulfill their God-given potential.
Happy Friday from Peru! ü´∂üèº

üíß La Uva, Nicaragua, once had plenty of water, but after a road reconstruction removed their pipeline, the community was left without access. Despite efforts, nothing changed‚Äîuntil one day, overwhelmed by the situation, community leader Rosibel prayed for a solution. With support from FH donors, the community finally received the help they needed. A resident named Osmin and his wife even donated their land for a new well. Now, after years of hardship, the people of La Uva have access to clean water once again! üôè Read their incredible journey to fresh, consistent water on our website.

"They die one at a time, so I‚Äôm going to help them one at a time." 
- Dr. Larry Ward, founder of Food for the Hungry. 

His vision started with one person and now reaches millions. üíö

‚ÄúI feel so joyful, so happy to know that my child is going to this new school that‚Äôs close and I know in the future she is going to be a very important person. She‚Äôll be prepared to be a teacher or a nurse. That is my dream, that my daughter will have a better life than I do.‚Äù üìö‚úèÔ∏èIn a remote Nicaraguan village, parents faced a tough choice: send their kids on a grueling two-mile walk to a distant, overcrowded school or keep them home, risking their futures. But these resilient parents knew education was key to breaking the cycle of poverty. With the support of Food for the Hungry and compassionate donors like you, they took action! üí™Together, they built a new school close to home, transforming not just their children‚Äôs futures but the entire community‚Äôs. #backtoschool2024 #educationforallchildren #allchildrenmatter #foodforthehungry

Did you know when communities have access to safe water, it increases school attendance rates?
 
Women and children typically bear the responsibility of collecting water for the family. They can spend up to 6 hours a day collecting water. All around the world, we are walking with communities to create accessible drinking and irrigation water, which ultimately allows kids to stay in school.
